Diagnosed a month ago SusanB12 SusanB12

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2007 07:13AM debic wrote: basil 16883 I find a lump went to ob she said she didn't feel anything but would send me for mamo, went for mamo they didn't see anything then did sonogram radiologist came in said i might want to think about biopsy. So thinking this isn't bad I made an appointment for the following month.  They called the next day after biopsy said all was okay to have another mamo in 6 months an hour later they called back to say sorry we made a mistake you have breast cnacer --have a nice day!! I too felt like I was left to find my own way.  My suggestion to you is see more then one doctor.  You will know when you have found the right surgeon. You need t feel comfortable with the surgeon and be able to ask as many questions as you want.  Write them down so you remember to ask them all.  If you can take someone with you as a second set of ears.  The same goes with the oncologist. I saw two then both suggested the same treatment but I went with the one I felt more comfortable with because this is a long journey and you need someone who will be with you all the way.  The best of luck to you remember you can do this. Debi
Posts.Title: How were you told basil16883 AnnNYC

Posts.Content: May 27, 2008 02:48PM debic wrote: Pam Where in Florida are you?  I live outside of Tampa.  I choose not to go to Moffitt because it was too big and they would not even see you unless you filled in a 75 page question sheet!!  Who could think to fill that in.  i went to Dr. Blumencranz office, I did not see him, but have been told he is very good. The dr in his office I saw I was not happy with.  I saw Dr. Nancy Taft, she was wonderful. It has been a year and a half and i still see her every three months.  You will know when you find the right dr. You should see more then one surgeon. I have a friend who works and MD Anderson and she also is a breast cancer patient there.  She loves the hospital and if you don't live close they do have a place for you and your family to stay during treatment.  Good Luck I finished my last treatment May 6th and welcomed my first grandchild into the world on May 9th----Life does go on. Debi
Posts.Title: M.D. Anderson Cancer Center of Orlando PaminFL cocoathunder

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2009 11:02AM debic wrote: Hi Ladies, I just wanted to stop in.  I was part of the April 2007 group.  Just want you to know there will be an end to this and life DOES get better!!   I did 4 DD AC 12 Taxol and a year of herceptin.  It wasn't always easy, but it is worth it.  Two days after my last treatment I had my first grandchild. He will be a year this month.  You are at the point you will be lossing your hair.  My hair is back looking better then before chemo, it is thicker I did not get the  curls alot of ladies did. It started growing when I was on Taxol. End of April through September was the wig time then just really short first cut in December. Your  group on this thread will get you though so much. Just remember  ask for meds if you don't feel well, ask for help if you are tired, take care of yourself. I wish you all the best. Debi
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo April 2009 tulipbebe MissouriCatLady

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2008 08:39AM debic wrote: Debbie, I had my port one year to the day when they found out it was leaking and had to come out. I asked if it had a one year warranty. My surgeon told me I could do day surgery or have it out in her office.  I opted for her office.  She numbed the area and removed it. the whole thing took about 30 minutes. The worse part was seeing the smoke come up when she catheterized the veins.  I asked her am I on fire?  I drove myself home and went on a 5 day cruise the next day.  I have to tell you the feeling a freedom with it out is wonderful. Good Luck in what you decide. Debi
Posts.Title: Port removal dhettish dhettish

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2007 01:22PM debic wrote: Diane, dig deep, God is with you. He has a plan for our lives sometimes we aren't sure if we like it but in the end it is always greater then a we had planned.  I know at times it has been hard to think this is his plan, but I know I could not have gotten through this without my faith.  I put all my faith in God and let the doctors thinkthey were in charge. Right before I was dx my daughter had a miscarriage at three months.  We asked why then I found out I had BC. I would have been in the middle of chemo when she had my first grandbaby. I will be done herceptin the first of May 08 , we just found out she will be having a baby the second week of May 08!! God has his own timing. In all my ways I acknowledge Him andHe directs my path. I'll keep you in my prayers. Debi

Posts.Content: debic wrote: Hi, I have a question about bone mets.  My dear friend was dx with IDC 8mm no nodes ER/PR+ in 2005 had rads is on Arumidex.  I just got "the call" she has bone mets!! What happens now? I also have BC IDC No nodes ER/PR + Her+ 4DD A/C 12 taxel/ herceptin just finished a year of herceptin alone., She has sat through every treatment with me. I am trying to be stronge for her. she does not come to this site I have been here everyday. I have tried to find as much as I can, but what happens now????? Thanks Debi Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bone Mets debic Betsey

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2008 08:38AM debic wrote: Thank you so much for your replies, This is why I come to this post you all seem to know how to make this breast of a disease managable.  I just want to be as strong for her as she was for me.  She is in so much pain right now that she can not think about it getting better.  They had done a Pet test and it came back neg so when they did the bone scan and they said bone mets it just shocked us.  I guess nothing should shock us about bc.  Our DH's have been really good support for each other, but I think they are wishing they could just be good fishing buddies and not sit in hospital buddies!! LuAnn those little babies are so cute!!  I had my last herceptin May 7th and became a grandmother for the first time on May 9th.  I too plan to be around to watch my little grandson grow up.  Enjoy every moment they grow up so fast!! Joanie is Xeloda a pill? 4.5 years that is wonderful thank you for letting me know. Barb You sound like you are going strong that is great.  Maybe now that they know my friend has bone mets she will get the treatment she needs and feel better.  She has been having pain and problems for a year they kept telling her it was from rads. Debi

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 12:30PM debic wrote: Lucky 8 I finished AC last May and did Taxol with herception.  I must tell you if you did AC Taxol will be much easier.  They Taxol is imporant for us estrogen positive tumors. Good Luck I am a year out and feeling great. Debi
